title: Ping spikes in windows 10...please help
body: I just recently had to re-install windows 10 due to changing my hard drive (not the cause of lag in case anyone is thinking it) and now when I play league I will get lag spikes when I change songs on pandora and some just random. I have nothing running but league and pandora, but its happening probably every other minute where i click and my champion is just stuck doing whatever he was doing, and i can see maybe like the health bar going down or the game like studdering trying to make my champion move and then a few seconds later I get "attempting to re-connect" and it connects a few secs later. I've tried some fixes can't say which ones offhand and tried the internet troubleshooter on league's site. Just give me any ideas that might help please I didn't have this lag before.

replies.body:
Your symptoms definitely sound like those commonly reported with packet loss and high packet buffering problems. These issues are commonly caused by either poor network routing to the server or local network settings that conflict with League.

I strongly recommend working through the steps outlined in our [connection troubleshooting guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) as a first step. Please let me know if those steps caused any change with your issue in-game.
